itemDescription: Scottish soldier, politician and colonial administrator

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Sir James Campbell, 1st Baronet (25 May 1763 – 5 June 1819) , 3rd of Inverneill House was a Scottish soldier, politician and colonial administrator. He was Governor and Commander-in-Chief of the Ionian Islands, Adjutant-General to the British Forces and Heritable Usher of the White Rod for Scotland. He is buried at Westminster Abbey.

response: * Sir James Campbell, 1st Baronet (1763–1819), British Army officer

link_mentions.page: Sir James Campbell, 1st Baronet, of Inverneill
French rule in the Ionian Islands (1807–1814)
response: *Albanian Regiment (Régiment Albanais) – formed on 12 October 1807 at three battalion strength of 9 companies each, but this was never achieved.  The decree to form the regiment stated it would consist of a staff and six battalions, giving it a strength of 160 officers and 2,934 men.  On 6 November 1813, the size of the regiment was reduced to a staff and two battalions, each consisting of one elite company and five of fusiliers.  The strength of each company was also reduced to three officers and 100 other ranks.  Following the surrender of Corfu in 1814, the regiment passed under the control of the new Commander-in-Chief and Governor of the British Ionian Islands, Sir James Campbell, 1st Baronet  who allowed it to dissolve through attrition.
*Sir James Campbell, 1st Baronet (1763–1819), British Army lieutenant general
